WorkItem.ClosedComment: I don't understand what you're proposing or what your example is trying to get at. Can you include a smaller example, or talk more specifically about how the proposed syntax differs from the current behavior?
WorkItem.Description:
https://gist.github.com/DavidBruant/6094995

I'd like to write the code in the client.ts file. Currently, I have to write what's in graph-ts-0.9.d.ts including adding some useless internal interfaces. This is due to the fact that the only constraint that can be put on generic types is "extends" which is a strict extends (doesn't includes the base class), while what I would need is a "is-a" constraint. 

The graph-hoped-ts.d.ts describes what I wish to author. The "is-a" keyword can obviously be replaced by anything else of your preference. I can more about the flexibility of the constraint than specific keywords :-)
WorkItem.Summary: More flexibility in constraints on generics
